comments:
I'm using Eclipse 3.4M3 + Mylyn 2.2.0.I20071107-1900 (downloaded from the update site at http://download.eclipse.org/tools/mylyn/update/weekly/e3.4

I can't access the eclipse.org bugzilla instance. It fails when it tries to download the product, components, etc. from the site. I got this particular error when trying to create a new query. I get similar errors when I try to open an editor on an existing bug (I managed to get a bug list using the URL query option).

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Error updating attributes.
Premature end of file.
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaCorePlugin.getRepositoryConfiguration(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.ui.BugzillaUiPlugin.updateQueryOptions(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.ui.search.BugzillaSearchPage$9.run(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[1]: java.io.IOException: Premature end of file.
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.AbstractReportFactory.collectResults(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.RepositoryConfigurationFactory.getConfiguration(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.getRepositoryConfiguration(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaCorePlugin.getRepositoryConfiguration(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.ui.BugzillaUiPlugin.updateQueryOptions(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.bugzilla.ui.search.BugzillaSearchPage$9.run(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Rob: could this be a malfunctioning mirror?

Wayne: is it recurring?  Denis has mirrored the config files, and it's feasible that a mirror has not entirely copied the file over.
This could be some form of connection error, either bugs.eclipse.org was having issues or some local network/proxy issue perhaps?

I tried this twice on Ubuntu Linux with the same result (i.e., I reinstalled from scratch). It worked just fine from a 3.3.1.1 drop running parallel.

I'll try to set it up from scratch on both Linux and Windows next week and report back the results.

I'm getting the same thing on Windows Vista. I tried a clean installation of Eclipse 3.4M3 and added all Mylyn features from the same update site (version 2.2.0.I20071119-1130). Same results.

I can successfully "Validate Settings" against the Eclipse Bugzilla instance from the "Task Repository Settings" dialogue.

It turns out that the problem occurs when I try to "Update Attributes from Repository" in every configuration I have. It's likely something on the server.

What URL are you using to obtain the attributes from the repository?
I'm getting back an empty document. Are you getting something different?

I spoke with Denis and it turns out that it's a function of how we at the foundation hit the server (though I swear I had the same problem at home... I'll check tonight). I'm reassigning the bug to webmaster.

Yeah we at the Ottawa office hit bugzilla through dev.eclipse.org for some irrelevant reason, and we don't get redirected to a mirror -- we hit the actual config.cgi perl script. For some reason I had commented out the "send XML to the browser" line way back when and forgot to uncomment it.

This never affected anyone on the outside, who was hitting bugs as bugs.eclipse.org and being redirected to a static version of the XML file on a mirror.  Apologies for the confusion.
Great! Thanks Denis.  Glad you're back up and running Wayne!
It occurred to me that it might be better to catch this exception and report an error to the user along the lines of "Mylyn cannot read the search attributes from the repository."

traces.message: Error updating attributes. Premature end of file.
